Thailand is a country of approximately 66 millions people. They are predominately Buddhist, accounting for almost 95% of the population. 4% are Muslim, and .5% claim Christianity.

![](http://sitesforchurch.s3.amazonaws.com/Religion_Chart.png)

The government of Thailand is a Constitutional Monarchy, which leads to freedoms that Thailand neighbors do not enjoy. One of the great freedoms is the freedom of religion. There are no restrictions as far as sharing The Gospel goes.
The economy is heavily dependent on exports and tourism, which makes for an environment friendly to foreigners.
